ques: I'm _______ to know what you decided.
She'll _______ your judgment.
They’ve _______ decided not to go.
You can leave _______ you want.
We know it’s _______ but we’re going anyway.
I _______ you made your decision.
_______ to Mr. Cooper, I can’t go.
I tried to _______ her to change her mind.
John _______ to make a decision.
It doesn’t make any _______
Will you accept my _______ ?
I gather you’ve decided _______ going to the movies.
I’ve always wanted to _______ abroad.
Last summer, I _______ to go to Europe.
_______ may be faster, but I prefer a leisurely boat ride.
It was difficult to decide what to _______ in my suitcases.
On the way to the pier, I was almost _______ in a collision.
After a comfortable trip, the ship _______ at the pier in Naples.
I _______ a bus to my hotel.
The bus _______ in just at dinner time.
I _______ my hotel room ready for me.
I _______ all through the Mediterranean countries that summer.
I'm going _______ a trip to New York. (on, by, with)
I prefer to go _______ sea. (in, by, with)
I like traveling _______ a boat. (on, with, for)
My brother isn’t going _______ me. (on, by, with)
He likes to go _______ air. (in, by, for)
He prefers traveling _______ a plane. (by, for, on)
My sister plans to take a trip _______ car. (by, for, on)
She enjoys riding _______ an automobile. (by, in, for)
My friend intends to travel _______ rail. (by, in, for)
He usually travels _______ the train. (for, on, to)
After we arrive, we will travel around the city _______ bus (for, by, to)
I went _______ last week.
The clothes I wanted were on _______
The clerk asked me what _______ suit I wear.
I didn’t _______ the pants or the shirt.
I hope they both _______ well.
If they don’t fit, I can get a _______
I was _______ in an overcoat, also.
I saw one that fit, but it was too _______
I want high _______ merchandise at a low price.
Everything I liked _______ too much money.
We _______ some friends out to dinner.
The menu had complete dinners as well as a la carte _______
For the _______, we each had a steak.
Our friends ordered theirs well-done, but we like ours _______
Wine was _______ with the steaks.
We each had a _______ of mashed potatoes and a salad with the main course.
For _______, we all had vanilla ice cream.
A bowl of fresh _______ was served after our coffee.
No one was in a _______ and we had a leisurely dinner.
Everyone _______ to enjoy the meal.
I'd like to ask _______ an appointment.
I can come any day _______ Thursday.
Please fill _______ this application form.
Have you written _______ an employment agency?
Were you interviewed _______ Mr. Cooper?
Did you change your appointment _______ Monday to Wednesday?
Did you put your signature _______ this application form?
Did you glance _______ the application form before you signed it?
Please make an appointment _______ you come.
Please lock _______ the office when you leave.
Please call before you come; _______ we might not be home.
I was forced to cancel my appointment _______ Mr. Cooper.
I went to see my doctor for an _______ check-up.
He told me I was spending too much time indoors and not getting enough _______
As a result, I was a little _______
He prescribed _______ of exercise
He also told me to stop _______ cigarettes
I told the doctor I'd had a slight _______ last summer.
I was under the care of a heart _______
The doctor took my _______
He told me I was _______
He gave me a _______ which showed I was anemic.
The doctor then _______ my eyes.
I asked the doctor if I should take any _______ for my bad health.
He told me that if I took care of myself, I would have nothing to _______ about.
explanation: "Anxious" means feeling worried or eager about something. It fits the context of wanting to know a decision, indicating eagerness or concern.
"Accept" means to agree with or receive something willingly. In this context, it means she will agree with or follow your judgment.
"Definitely" indicates certainty and finality in a decision, which fits the context of having made a clear decision not to go.
"Whenever" refers to any time, fitting the context of being able to leave at any time desired.
"Dangerous" fits the context of acknowledging a risk but deciding to proceed regardless.
"Assume" means to suppose something is true without evidence. In this context, it fits the idea of believing a decision has been made.
"According" is used to refer to someone's statement or opinion. Here, it indicates that Mr. Cooper has said something that affects the speaker's ability to go.
"Persuade" means to convince someone to do or believe something. It fits the context of trying to change someone's mind.
"Refuses" means to decline or reject something. In this context, it indicates John's unwillingness to make a decision.
"Difference" means a distinction or change. The phrase "doesn't make any difference" means it doesn't matter or change anything.
"Explanation" means a statement that makes something clear. In this context, it refers to providing a reason or justification that needs to be accepted.
"Against" means in opposition to. Here, it indicates deciding not to go to the movies.
"Travel" means to go from one place to another, especially over a long distance. It fits the context of wanting to go abroad.
"Decided" means to make a choice or come to a conclusion. In this context, it indicates making the choice to go to Europe.
"Flying" is often the fastest mode of travel, contrasting with the preference for a leisurely boat ride.
"Pack" means to put items into a container, especially for traveling. It fits the context of preparing suitcases for a trip.
"Injured" means to be hurt or harmed. It fits the context of being almost involved in a collision.
"Docked" means to bring a ship into a dock. It fits the context of the ship arriving at the pier.
"Took" means to use a mode of transport. In this context, it fits the action of using a bus to get to the hotel.
"Pulled in" means to arrive at a destination. It fits the context of the bus arriving at the hotel at dinner time.
"Found" means to discover something. In this context, it indicates discovering that the hotel room was ready.
"Traveled" means to go from one place to another. It fits the context of moving through different Mediterranean countries.
"On" is used to indicate being part of an event or activity. In this context, it fits the phrase "going on a trip."
"By" is used to indicate the means or method of travel. Here, it specifies traveling by sea.
"On" is used to indicate being on a mode of transport. Here, it refers to being on a boat.
"With" indicates companionship or being together with someone. Here, it means the brother is not accompanying the speaker.
"By" is used to indicate the method of travel. Here, it means traveling by air.
"On" is used to indicate being on a mode of transport. Here, it refers to being on a plane.
"By" is used to indicate the method of travel. Here, it means traveling by car.
"In" is used to indicate being inside a vehicle. Here, it refers to being in an automobile.
"By" is used to indicate the method of travel. Here, it means traveling by rail.
"On" is used to indicate being on a mode of transport. Here, it refers to being on the train.
"By" is used to indicate the method of travel. Here, it means traveling by bus.
"Shopping" fits the context as it refers to the activity of buying things, which aligns with the idea of clothes being on sale.
"Sale" means the items are being sold at a reduced price, which is why the speaker wanted them.
"Size" refers to the dimensions of clothing, which is essential for ensuring a proper fit.
"Try on" means to put on clothes to see if they fit or look good, which is typically done before purchasing.
"Fit" refers to whether the clothes are the right size and shape for the person, which is the concern when trying on clothing.
"Refund" means getting your money back, which is what you would seek if the clothes do not fit.
"Interested" indicates the speaker's desire or curiosity about the overcoat.
"Expensive" means costing a lot of money, indicating why the speaker did not purchase the overcoat.
"Quality" refers to the standard of something as measured against other things of a similar kind, indicating the speaker's desire for well-made merchandise.
"Cost" refers to the amount of money needed to buy something, indicating that the items were too expensive for the speaker.
"Invited" means to ask someone to join you for an event or activity. In this context, it indicates asking friends to join for dinner.
"Selections" refers to the various individual items available on the menu. It fits the context of a la carte items.
"Main course" refers to the primary dish in a meal. In this context, it indicates that steak was the main dish.
"Medium rare" is a specific level of doneness for steak, which fits the context of how the speaker likes their steak cooked.
"Served" means to present or provide food or drink to someone. In this context, it indicates that wine was provided with the meal.
"Generous portion" means a large amount of food. It fits the context of having a substantial amount of mashed potatoes and salad.
"Dessert" is the sweet course typically eaten at the end of a meal. In this context, it refers to the vanilla ice cream.
"Fruit" refers to the edible, sweet product of a plant. In this context, it indicates what was served after the coffee.
"Hurry" means to move or act with urgency. In this context, it indicates that everyone took their time during dinner.
"Seemed" means to give the impression of having a particular quality. In this context, it indicates that everyone appeared to enjoy the meal.
"For" is used to indicate the purpose of the request. In this context, it means to ask for the purpose of scheduling an appointment.
"Besides" means in addition to; except for. In this context, it indicates that Thursday is the only day not available.
"Fill out" means to complete a form by providing the required information. It fits the context of completing an application form.
"To" is used to indicate the recipient of the action. In this context, it means to send a written communication to an employment agency.
"By" indicates the person who conducts the interview. Here, it specifies that Mr. Cooper is the interviewer.
"From" indicates the starting point of the change, and "to" indicates the ending point. It shows that the appointment was rescheduled from Monday to Wednesday.
"On" is used to indicate placement or location. In this context, it means placing a signature on the application form.
"At" is used to indicate the direction of a brief look. In this context, it means to look quickly at the application form.
"When" is used to indicate the time of an action. Here, it means to make an appointment at the time you plan to come.
"Lock up" means to secure a place by locking all doors and windows. It fits the context of securing the office when leaving.
"Otherwise" indicates a consequence if the previous condition is not met. Here, it means that without calling, you might find no one home.
"With" is used to indicate the person involved in the action. In this context, it means to cancel an appointment that was scheduled with Mr. Cooper.
"Annual" means occurring once every year. In this context, it refers to a yearly medical examination.
"Exercise" refers to physical activity that is done to stay healthy. The context suggests a lack of physical activity.
"Overweight" means having more body weight than is considered healthy. This fits the context of not getting enough exercise.
"Plenty" means a large or sufficient amount. In this context, it suggests a significant amount of exercise is needed.
"Smoking" refers to inhaling and exhaling the smoke of burning tobacco. It fits the context of a doctor's advice for better health.
"Heart attack" refers to a medical emergency where the blood flow to the heart is blocked. It fits the context of a serious health condition mentioned to a doctor.
"Specialist" means a doctor who is an expert in a particular area of medicine. In this context, it refers to a doctor who specializes in heart health.
"Blood pressure" refers to the force of blood against the walls of arteries. It's a common measure taken during a check-up.
"Near-sighted" means having difficulty seeing distant objects clearly. It fits the context of a common vision issue diagnosed by a doctor.
"Blood test" is a laboratory analysis performed on a blood sample. It can reveal conditions like anemia.
"Examined" means to inspect or investigate thoroughly. In this context, it refers to a close inspection of the eyes by the doctor.
"Medicine" refers to drugs or remedies used to treat or prevent illness. It fits the context of asking about treatment for health issues.
"Worry" means to feel anxious or troubled about actual or potential problems. It fits the context of assuring someone about their health.
